intro: Pedicellia sundaica, commonly known as the Sunda pedicellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Pedicellia sundaica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and swampy areas.
